012     *******************************************************************************/
013    package net.sf.oval;
014    
015    import java.io.Serializable;
016    import java.util.Map;
017    
018    import net.sf.oval.context.OValContext;
019    import net.sf.oval.exception.OValException;
020    
021    /**
022     * interface for classes that can check/validate if a constraint is satisfied
023     * 
024     * @author Sebastian Thomschke
025     */
026    public interface Check extends Serializable
027    {
028            /**
029             * <p>In case the constraint is declared for an array, collection or map this controls how the constraint is applied to it and it's child objects.
030             * 
031             * <p><b>Default:</b> ConstraintTarget.CONTAINER
032             * 
033             * <p><b>Note:</b> This setting is ignored for object types other than array, map and collection.
034             */
035            ConstraintTarget[] getAppliesTo();
036    
037            /**
038             * @return Returns the context where the constraint was declared.
039             * 
040             * @see net.sf.oval.context.ClassContext
041             * @see net.sf.oval.context.ConstraintSetContext
042             * @see net.sf.oval.context.FieldContext
043             * @see net.sf.oval.context.MethodEntryContext
044             * @see net.sf.oval.context.MethodExitContext
045             * @see net.sf.oval.context.MethodParameterContext
046             * @see net.sf.oval.context.MethodReturnValueContext
047             */
048            OValContext getContext();
049    
050            /**
051             * @return the error code that will be used in a corresponding ConstraintViolation object
052             */
053            String getErrorCode();
054    
055            /** 
056             * gets the default message that is displayed if a corresponding message key
057             * is not found in the messages properties file
058             * <br>
059             * default processed place holders are:
060             * <ul>
061             * <li>{context} => specifies which getter, method parameter or field was validated
062             * <li>{invalidValue} => string representation of the validated value
063             * </ul>
064             */
065            String getMessage();
066    
067            /**
068             * values that are used to fill place holders when rendering the error message.
069             * A key "min" with a value "4" will replace the place holder {min} in an error message
070             * like "Value cannot be smaller than {min}" with the string "4".
071             */
072            Map<String, ? > getMessageVariables();
073    
074            /**
075             * @return the profiles, may return null
076             */
077            String[] getProfiles();
078    
079            /**
080             * @return the severity
081             */
082            int getSeverity();
083    
084            /**
085             * Formula returning <code>true</code> if this constraint shall be evaluated and
086             * <code>false</code> if it shall be ignored for the current validation.
087             * <p>
088             * <b>Important:</b> The formula must be prefixed with the name of the scripting language that is used.
089             * E.g. <code>groovy:_this.amount > 10</code>
090             * <p>
091             * Available context variables are:<br>
092             * <b>_this</b> -&gt; the validated bean<br>
093             * <b>_value</b> -&gt; the value to validate (e.g. the field value, parameter value, method return value,
094             *    or the validated bean for object level constraints)
095             *    
096             * @return the formula
097             */
098            String getWhen();
099    
100            /**
101             * 
102             * @param validatedObject the object/bean to validate the value against, for static fields or methods this is the class
103             * @param valueToValidate the value to validate, may be null when validating pre conditions for static methods
104             * @param validator the calling validator
105             * @return <code>true</code> if this check is active and must be satisfied
106             */
107            boolean isActive(Object validatedObject, Object valueToValidate, Validator validator);
108    
109            /**
110             * This method implements the validation logic
111             * 
112             * @param validatedObject the object/bean to validate the value against, for static fields or methods this is the class
113             * @param valueToValidate the value to validate, may be null when validating pre conditions for static methods
114             * @param context the validation context (e.g. a field, a constructor parameter or a method parameter)
115             * @param validator the calling validator
116             * @return true if the value satisfies the checked constraint
117             */
118            boolean isSatisfied(Object validatedObject, Object valueToValidate, OValContext context, Validator validator)
119                            throws OValException;
120    
121            /**
122             * @param target the constraint target to set
123             */
124            void setAppliesTo(ConstraintTarget... target);
125    
126            /**
127             * @param context the context to set
128             */
129            void setContext(OValContext context);
130    
131            /**
132             * @param errorCode the error code to set
133             */
134            void setErrorCode(String errorCode);
135    
136            /**
137             * sets the default message that is displayed if a corresponding message key
138             * is not found in the messages properties file
139             * 
140             * <br>
141             * default processed place holders are:
142             * <ul>
143             * <li>{context} => specifies which getter, method parameter or field was validated
144             * <li>{invalidValue} => string representation of the validated value
145             * </ul>
146             */
147            void setMessage(String message);
148    
149            /**
150             * @param profiles the profiles to set
151             */
152            void setProfiles(String... profiles);
153    
154            /**
155             * @param severity the severity to set
156             */
157            void setSeverity(int severity);
158    
159            /**
160             * Sets the formula returning <code>true</code> if this constraint shall be evaluated and
161             * <code>false</code> if it shall be ignored for the current validation.
162             * <p>
163             * <b>Important:</b> The formula must be prefixed with the name of the scripting language that is used.
164             * E.g. <code>groovy:_this.amount > 10</code>
165             * <p>
166             * Available context variables are:<br>
167             * <b>_this</b> -&gt; the validated bean<br>
168             * <b>_value</b> -&gt; the value to validate (e.g. the field value, parameter value, method return value,
169             *    or the validated bean for object level constraints)
170             *  
171             * @param when formula calculating if this check is active
172             */
173            void setWhen(final String when);
174    }
